a.title: Closed Through the end of the 2019-2020 school year

img.title: Closed Through the end of the 2019-2020 school year

span.div: The Bethel Park School District will be closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, following the orders of Pennsylvania Governor Tom Wolf, to help save lives and stop the spread of COVID-19. Here are some of the events that will be impacted:

DISTRIBUTION OF FREE MEALS--UPDATED APRIL 13, 2020
Beginning Tuesday, April 14, the District is working with our food service management company to provide meals to anyone age 18 and younger.
A Breakfast meal will consist of cereal, juice and milk.
A Lunch meal will consist of a sandwich, fruit, snack and milk. Parents/Guardians who are interested in obtaining these meals for their children must click here by 6 PM to place their order for pick up the following day between 11:30 AM and 1 PM at the Bethel Park High School Main Entrance. Meals will be offered Monday through Friday as long as the District remains closed due to the Coronavirus.

div.strong: Phone orders will no longer be accepted. All orders must be placed online.
The form must be completed every time the meals are needed.

span.div: Please click here to also see a map of free Food Distribution Sites in the area, should your family need to avail themselves of this service.

To help stop the spread of the Coronavirus, all Bethel Park School Board Meetings will be conducted virtually, with no members of the public in the audience, to ensure everyone's health and safety. The public can watch the meetings on Facebook live. BPTV will also record the meetings for re-broadcast on its cable TV and YouTube channels. Public comments will be accepted via email and called into the meeting at the appropriate times. The next School Board Meeting is a Regular Voting Meeting, followed by the April Committee Meeting, scheduled for Tuesday, April 21 at 7 PM. Please click here to learn how the public can view the meeting remotely and share public comments.

span.strong: INSTRUCTION DURING THIS TIME OF CLOSURE--UPDATED APRIL 14

div.strong: The Bethel Park School District began its Continuity of Education Plan for all BPSD students (Grades K-12) the week of March 30.

div.div: The Continuity of Education Plan has been designed to be educational and engaging, but not overwhelming to students or families who may need to provide assistance to their children. Please click here to learn more about the plan as it will unfold during the Fourth Quarter of the 2019-2020 school year.

Extensions will be provided on an individual basis for those students who are eligible or thought-to-be eligible for Section 504 Accommodations or IEP services. For further information or to discuss any concerns you may have about your child’s special education services, please contact Lori Sutton, Director of Special Education, at 412-854-8405, or by emailing [email protected].
We appreciate everyone's patience as we continue to work through the process to provide students with a meaningful education program until it is safe to resume traditional learning in our classrooms.

In addition to the lessons teachers will be providing, the District has established a list of helpful educational resources/links for students and families to use, should they want to avail themselves of this. These resources can be accessed by clicking here. We hope that this link will provide helpful educational resources for families to make the best of our current circumstances.
It is our intention at this time to keep the last day for students at Thursday, June 4, 2020. To provide as much instructional time as possible, here are the changes to the 2019-2020 calendar:

• Tuesday, April 14 will be a Teacher Records Day.
• Report Cards will be available in eSchoolPlus on Friday, April 17 for parents/guardians and students to review.
• The Fourth Nine Weeks will begin on Wednesday, April 15.
• The April 28 Inservice Day has been cancelled and will now count as a Student Day of School.
Please keep in mind that there may be future adjustments to the 2019-2020 calendar due to possible changing circumstances. We will continue to update this page if changes occur.

span.div: The Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) announced on March 19, 2020 the cancellation of all PSSA testing and Keystone exams for the 2019-20 school year as a result of COVID-19. This includes the Pennsylvania Alternate System of Assessment (PASA). To read more, please click here.

div.div: All athletic events and practices have been cancelled for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
All evening/weekend activities for school and community groups that are held in the schools have been cancelled during the closure.

To encourage the public to practice safe social distancing guidelines as suggested by the Centers for Disease Control, the PA Department of Health and other health organizations, Everyone is encouraged to practice safe social distancing to mitigate the spread of the Coronavirus, and to help ensure as speedy a return to normal life as possible, all Bethel Park School District outdoor facilities have been CLOSED to the public, including but not limited to tracks, fields, playgrounds and tennis courts.
The District continues to explore its options for ensuring that all schools are completely sanitized/disinfected prior to school resuming.

span.strong: BETHEL PARK HIGH SCHOOL AND INDEPENDENCE MIDDLE SCHOOL MUSICALS

div.div: We are disappointed to have to cancel this year’s production of “Guys and Dolls” at Bethel Park High School, as well as the remaining two nights of “Mary Poppins” at Independence Middle School. We are in the process of setting up a procedure for those who have already purchased tickets to get their money refunded. We will be sharing that information on our website, social media pages, information line and e-mail newsletters once the details are finalized for how refunds will be given.

ul.li: Comcast (offering two months free internet to low income families)
Spectrum (offering free internet services to students)

span.strong: Links To Other Helpful Health Websites

li.strong: All SAT and ACT Testing Dates through June have been cancelled.

span.p: We encourage everyone to follow the recommendations of the CDC and health officials, including practicing social distancing, washing your hands often, covering coughs and sneezes, avoiding touching your face, avoiding those who are sick, and simply staying home, especially if you’re sick.
span.div: This prolonged state-wide closure is a unique situation for all Pennsylvania school districts, and we thank you for your understanding and patience as we continue to work through the details to answer all of your questions. We will continue to update you as necessary. Thank you for support and understanding that all decisions are made out of concern for the health and safety of our students, staff, and families.
